name: @Arodoid/unitymcp
description: Integrate AI assistants seamlessly into your Unity projects. Monitor editor states, execute commands in real-time, and manage logs efficiently to enhance your development workflow.

tools.name: get_editor_state

returns.format:
The response format varies based on the format parameter:
- Raw: Full UnityEditorState object
- scripts only: Array of script file paths
- no scripts: UnityEditorState minus script-related fields
returns.description: Returns a JSON object containing the requested editor state information

tools.description: Retrieve the current state of the Unity Editor, including active GameObjects, selection state, play mode status, scene hierarchy, and project structure. This tool provides a comprehensive snapshot of the editor's current context.

format.description:
Specify the output format:
- Raw: Complete editor state including all available data
- scripts only: Returns only the list of script files in the project
- no scripts: Returns everything except script-related information

tools.name: execute_editor_command

returns.description: Returns the execution result and any logs generated during execution

input.code: var selected = Selection.activeGameObject; if(selected != null) { selected.transform.position = Vector3.zero; }

tools.description: Execute arbitrary C# code within the Unity Editor context. This powerful tool allows for direct manipulation of the Unity Editor, GameObjects, components, and project assets using the Unity Editor API.

code.description: C# code to execute in the Unity Editor context. The code has access to all UnityEditor and UnityEngine APIs.

scenarios.handling: Returns compilation error details in logs
Returns exception details and stack trace

errorHandling.description: Common error scenarios and their handling:

tools.name: get_logs

returns.format: Array of objects containing requested log entry fields
returns.description: Returns an array of log entries matching the specified filters

tools.description: Retrieve and filter Unity Editor logs with comprehensive filtering options. This tool provides access to editor logs, console messages, warnings, errors, and exceptions with powerful filtering capabilities.

count.description: Maximum number of log entries to return

types.description: Filter logs by type. If not specified, all types are included.

fields.description: Specify which fields to include in the output. If not specified, all fields are included.

timestampAfter.description: Filter logs after this ISO timestamp (inclusive)

messageContains.description: Filter logs to only include entries where the message contains this string (case-sensitive)

timestampBefore.description: Filter logs before this ISO timestamp (inclusive)

stackTraceContains.description: Filter logs to only include entries where the stack trace contains this string (case-sensitive)
